summary: This is an email from November 30, 2020, discussing a legal briefing about the defense's entitlement to witness identities in advance of trial. It references a prior denial by Judge Nathan and mentions checking with others regarding an exhibit list point.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Referred to as the judge who denied the defense's request for witness identities without prejudice.

events.title: Letter to Judge Nathan regarding victim names and prison privileges
events.description: A letter was filed with the court (docketed) addressing victim names and prison privileges.

events.title: Email discussing witness list briefing
events.description: An email was sent briefing about arguments regarding the defense's access to witness identities before trial.

keyFacts: The defense sought witness identities in advance of trial, but Judge Nathan denied the request without prejudice.
The denial allows the defense to re-raise the issue after receiving all discovery.
An attached letter from August 13, 2020, addressed victim names and prison privileges.
The email indicates coordination among legal team members regarding briefing on exhibit lists.
